official-title.#text: To enable States to opt out of certain provisions of the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act.

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

It is the purpose of this Act to protect States' rights and to ensure that States have the option to continue to implement State laws relating to health care delivery and health insurance that were in effect prior to the date of enactment of the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act
public-law/111/148

header.#text: Protection of State flexibility to provide health coverage
State opt out of certain provisions of PPACA

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: with respect to health insurance coverage within that State.

text.#text: A State described in this subsection is a State that enacts a law after the date of enactment of this Act that—

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: State Health Care Choice Act/s:3/ss:a

text.#text: expresses the intent of the State to opt out of one or more of the provisions of the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: described in

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act
public-law/111/148

text.#text: contains a list of the provisions of such Act which will not apply to the State under the State law; and

expresses the intent of the State to continue to administer health coverage-related laws as in effect in the State on March 23, 2010, or that provides for the implementation of related State laws enacted after such date.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , the provisions of the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: State Health Care Choice Act/s:3/ss:b/p:1

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: listed in such law shall apply with respect to such State beginning on the date of such repeal.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act

text.#text: If a State repeals a law described in

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , in consultation with the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Secretary of Health and Human Services

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , shall promulgate regulations to provide for the implementation of this Act.
